oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Good Samaritan Missionary Baptist Church, 2002 February
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Good Samaritan Missionary Baptist Church historically located at 515 Houston Street in Nashville, Tennessee. According to the most recent city directory, the church's current address is listed as 509 Houston Street. Originally called Houston Street Baptist Church, the structure was built in 1950. In the 1960s the name changed to Good Samaritan Missionary Baptist Church. The foundation is concrete masonry. The exterior walls are a combination of concrete masonry, vinyl siding, and asphalt shingles. There is an asphalt shingle gabled roof. The windows are red glass with wrought iron bars. The doors are wood with plexi-glass panes and wrought iron ornamentation. Special features include a small steeple. Additions include and a two-story concrete masonry, gable roofed structure attached to the rear of the church. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Good Samaritan Missionary Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Good Samaritan Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Houston Street Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
